JOB DESCRIPTION: Description  At Fortanix, we are redefining cloud security. We are seeking DevOps engineers to build, maintain, and improve our production infrastructure and development tools. The DevOps Team has wide-ranging impact at Fortanix: we ensure that all Fortanix Engineers can reliably, efficiently, and safely deliver our product to customers; we measure, monitor, and automate whenever and whatever we can; we continually look for ways to improve ourselves and our tools.    You will:  Contribute to a friendly and helpful company culture  Build and maintain automation to improve the efficiency of all Fortanix engineers  Define the production metrics we should track, and ensure we?re monitoring them.  Participate in on-call rotation  Contribute to defining security best-practices, and ensuring our infrastructure adheres to them  Write and deploy code, and continue to find ways to make it easier for your peers to do the same.   Requirements  You are someone who:  Exhibits uncompromising integrity  Pays attention to detail  Thinks critically about complex technical problems  Can work independently, while also being an effective member of a team  Is interested in continual learning and improvement   You have:  3+ years of software engineering experience, preferably in a DevOps-related role   Proficiency in a scripting language, such as Python, Ruby, Perl, or Bash   An understanding of networking protocols, such as IP, DNS, TCP, TLS   Experience with Linux administration  Experience with one or more of:   Virtualization or container environments like KVM and Docker   Orchestration frameworks like Kubernetes, OpenShift   Configuration and provisioning management tools like Chef, Ansible, and Puppet   Monitoring tools such as Sensu, Prometheus, Nagios or similar   Continuous integration systems like Jenkins and Travis   Technology we use:  Jenkins, Travis   Chef, Ansible, Terraform   Linux, Docker, Kubernetes   Cloud: AWS, Azure, GCP, IBM Cloud  Sensu  Python, Bash
